Topic: Draw a habitat and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can draw different types of habitats, such as a playground, garden, forest, or pond.
The student can illustrate a variety of living things in each habitat, like trees, grasses, bushes, lizards, squirrels, fish, and flowering plants.
The student can compare and contrast the different living things found in the land habitats and those found in the water habitats.
The student can use observations from media or firsthand experiences to accurately represent the biodiversity of each habitat.
The student can identify and show patterns of plant and animal diversity across different habitats in their drawing.
